alert.note: Alert for Dundy; Hitchcock; Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 23 at 2:30AM CST until December 23 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST /NOON CST/ THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 AM MST /9 AM CST/ SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, life threateningly cold wind chills as low as 40 degrees below zero. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills as low as 20 degrees below zero. * WHERE...The entire Tri-state area. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 11 AM MST /noon CST/ this morning. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ this afternoon to 8 AM MST /9 AM CST/ Saturday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear multiple layers and cover all exposed skin. When traveling, make sure to carry an emergency kit including extra clothes, a blanket, food and a flashlight.
